info.title: REST API - OJS
info.description:
This guide documents the REST API endpoints which can be accessed with this version of [Open Journal Systems](https://pkp.sfu.ca/ojs/). It is a technical reference for software developers who wish to build custom interactions with the platform.

Please consult the [REST API Usage Guide](/dev/api) for an introduction to using the API or the [Developer Documentation Hub](/dev) for technical documentation on the software.

**Breaking changes since v3.2**
* Major changes were made to how galleys are fetched and new endpoints were added for submission files. See the documentation for full details.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Only admins, journal editors, and subeditors can access these endpoints.

tags.name: Contexts
tags.description: Only admins and journal managers can access these endpoints.

tags.name: Site
tags.description: Only admins can access these endpoints, which should be accessed using `_` instead of the journal path.

tags.name: Announcements
tags.description: Only admins and journal managers can access these endpoints.

tags.name: Email Templates
tags.description: Only admins and journal managers can access these endpoints.

tags.name: Stats / Editorial
tags.description: Only admins and journal managers can access these endpoints.

tags.name: Stats / Publications
tags.description: Only admins and journal managers can access these endpoints.

tags.name: Stats / Users
tags.description: Only admins and journal managers can access these endpoints.

tags.name: Vocabs
tags.description: Handle controlled vocabularies like keywords and subjects. Only admins, journal managers, subeditors, assistants and authors can access these endpoints.

tags.name: Temporary Files
tags.description: A special endpoint to be used for handling file uploads. See the [API Usage Guide](/dev/api) for more information.

tags.name: Backend
tags.description: Private endpoints for OJS's UI. These endpoints will be less stable between versions. We discourage their use in third-party plugins or applications.

get.description: See `/submissions/{submissionId}` for notes about submission properties.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter results by one or more submission statuses. Must match the value of one of the `STATUS_QUEUED`, `STATUS_SCHEDULED`, `STATUS_PUBLISHED` or `STATUS_DECLINED` constants.

parameters.name: assignedTo
parameters.description: Filter results by those assigned to one or more user ids. All users except managers and admins are automatically restricted to assigned submissions and do not need to pass this parameter.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many results to return in a single request. Max is `100`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset the results returned. Use this to receive subsequent pages of requests. A `count` of `10` and `offset` of `15` will return results `15` to `25`.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order the results returned.

parameters.name: orderDirection
parameters.description: Return the results in ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: isIncomplete
parameters.description: Filter the results by those for which the author has not yet completed the submission process.

parameters.name: isOverdue
parameters.description: Filter the results by those for which a reviewer has missed a deadline.

parameters.name: daysInactive
parameters.description: Filter the results by those which have not had activity for the last X days.

parameters.name: sectionIds
parameters.description: Filter the results by those with one or more publications assigned to a section.

parameters.name: issueIds
parameters.description: Filter the results by those with one or more publications assigned to an issue.

parameters.name: searchPhrase
parameters.description: Filter the results by a search phrase matched against the title and authors.

200.description: List of requested submissions.

403.description: You do not have permission to access submissions assigned to the user requested in the `assignedTo` parameter.

requestBody.description: Details about the submission that should be created.

200.description: Details of the submission that was just added.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

get.description:
* Unpublished submissions are only returned for assigned participants, editors and admins.
* `abstract` includes HTML markup.
* `pages` is usually a `string`. But in some cases it may return an array of arrays. Each array contains two items: the start and end page. Example: `[[25, 31], [45, 62]]`.
* `submissionProgress` will be > 0 if the submission is incomplete.
* `stages`, `reviewRounds` and `reviewAssignments` should only be returned for participants assigned to the submission.
* `reviewAssignments` should only expose user-identifying information for editors and admins.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

200.description: The submission details.

403.description: You do not have permission to access this submissions.

404.description: The submission could not be found.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

requestBody.description: The details about the submission that you want to edit. All params are optional. When a param is omitted, the existing value of that param will not be modified.

200.description: The submission that was just edited with the new values after the update has occurred.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

403.description:
This error indicates one of the following:
* You are not allowed to edit a submission from the site-wide endpoint. You must use a context (journal/press/server) endpoint.
* You are not allowed to change the context (journal/press/server) of a submission.

404.description: The submission could not be found.

delete.description: Only journal managers and subeditors can make a request to this endpoint.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

200.description: Details of the deleted submission.

403.description: You are not allowed to delete this submission.

404.description: The submission could not be found.

get.description:
This will return all of a submission's files that the user is allowed to access, except review attachments and discussion files. A user is allowed to access different file stages depending on their stage assignment.
* Managers, subeditors and assistants can access all file stages if they are assigned to the matching workflow stage. For example, an assistant assigned to the copyediting stage can access files in `SUBMISSION_FILE_COPYEDIT` and `SUBMISSION_FILE_FINAL`.
* Authors are restricted to the `SUBMISSION_FILE_SUBMISSION`, `SUBMISSION_FILE_REVIEW_REVISION`, `SUBMISSION_FILE_COPYEDIT` and `SUBMISSION_FILE_PROOF` file stages. For example, an author with access to the copyediting stage will have access to `SUBMISSION_FILE_COPYEDIT` (copyedited files) but not `SUBMISSION_FILE_FINAL` (draft files).
* Reviewers and readers are not allowed to access this endpoint.
* Managers who are not assigned to the submission are allowed to access all file stages as though they are assigned to every workflow stage.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: fileStages
parameters.description: Filter results by those submission files assigned to one or more file stage. One of the `SUBMISSION_FILE_` constants.

parameters.name: reviewRoundIds
parameters.description: Filter results by those submission files assigned to one or more review rounds.

200.description: An array of the requested submission files.

403.description:
You do not have permission to view the requested files.

|Error Code|Description|
|---|---|
|`api.403.unauthorized`|You are not allowed to access files for this submission.|
|`api.submissionFiles.403.unauthorizedFileStageId`|You are not allowed to access files in one or more of the `fileStages` requested.|
|`api.submissionFiles.403.unauthorizedReviewRound`|You are not allowed to access files in one or more of the `reviewRoundIds` requested.

post.description: A user is allowed to upload to different file stages depending on their stage assignments. See the description for `GET /submission/{submissionId}/files` above. Once a submission has been completed, authors are no longer allowed to upload to `SUBMISSION_FILE_SUBMISSION`. Authors are not allowed to upload to `SUBMISSION_FILE_REVIEW_REVISION` until revisions have been requested.

requestBody.description: Details about the submission file that should be created.

200.description: The new submission file.

400.description: There was an error when uploading the file or the values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

403.description: You are not allowed to upload a file to the specified file stage of this submission.

get.description: You must pass the correct `stageId` when requesting a file.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: submissionFileId
parameters.description: Submission File ID

parameters.name: stageId
parameters.description: The workflow stage id of the requested file. For example, `WORKFLOW_STAGE_ID_PRODUCTION`.

200.description: Details of the submission file.

403.description: You are not allowed to access the requested file.

put.description: You must pass the correct `stageId` when editing a file.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: submissionFileId
parameters.description: Submission File ID

parameters.name: stageId
parameters.description: The workflow stage id of the file to be edited. For example, `WORKFLOW_STAGE_ID_PRODUCTION`.

requestBody.description: The details about the submission file that you want to edit. All params are optional. When a param is omitted, the existing value of that param will not be modified.

200.description: The submission file that was just edited with the new values after the update has occurred.

400.description: There was an error when uploading the file or the values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

403.description: You are not allowed to edit the requested file.

delete.description: You must pass the correct `stageId` when deleting a file.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: submissionFileId
parameters.description: Submission File ID

parameters.name: stageId
parameters.description: The workflow stage id of the file to be edited. For example, `WORKFLOW_STAGE_ID_PRODUCTION`.

200.description: The submission file that was just deleted.

403.description: You are not allowed to delete the requested file.

get.description: Get the participants assigned to a submisssion.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

200.description: List of users assigned to a submission

404.description: The requested submission could not be found.

get.description: Get all participants assigned to a submission for a specific workflow stage, such as the review or copyediting stage.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: stageId
parameters.description: Stage ID

200.description: List of users assigned to the requested stage of the requested submission

404.description: The requested submission could not be found.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

200.description: List of publications for this submission.

404.description: The requested submission could not be found.

post.description: Create a new publication for a submission.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: publicationId
parameters.description: Publication ID

requestBody.description: Details about the publication that should be created.

200.description: Details of the publication that was just added.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: publicationId
parameters.description: Publication ID

200.description: The publication details

404.description: The requested submission or publication could not be found.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: publicationId
parameters.description: Publication ID

requestBody.description: The details about the publication that you want to edit. All params are optional. When a param is omitted, the existing value of that param will not be modified.

200.description: The publication that was just edited with the new values after the update has occurred.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

403.description:
This error indicates one of the following:
* The publication you want to edit does not belong to this submission.
* This publication is published and can not be edited. You must create and publish a new version.
* You do not have permission to edit this publication.
* You are not allowed to modify the `status` of a publication. You must use the `/submissions/{submissionId}/publications/{publicationId}/publish` and `.../unpublish` endpoints to modify the status of a publication.

404.description: The publication could not be found.

delete.description: Only journal managers and subeditors can make a request to this endpoint.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: publicationId
parameters.description: Publication ID

200.description: The publication that was just deleted.

403.description:
This may mean one of the following:
* You are not allowed to delete this publication.
* The publication does not belong to this submission.
* This publication is published and can not be deleted.

404.description: The submission could not be found.

post.summary: Create a new version of a publication.
post.description: Duplicate a publication, including author and galley records, in order to create a new version of a publication that can be edited.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: publicationId
parameters.description: Publication ID

200.description: Details of the new publication that was created.

403.description: The publication you want to version does not belong to this submission.

404.description: The publication could not be found.

put.description:
If the publication is assigned to an issue that is not yet published, it will be scheduled for publication and the `status` will be set to `STATUS_SCHEDULED`. If the issue is already published, it will be published immediately and the `status` will be set to `STATUS_PUBLISHED`.

The publication will be validated against any publishing requirements before it is published and a `400` response will be returned if it fails validation.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: publicationId
parameters.description: Publication ID

200.description: Details of the publication that was just published.

400.description: One or more publication requirements have not been met.

403.description: A 403 response means that the publication you want to version does not belong to this submission or that the publication is already published.

404.description: The publication could not be found.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: Submission ID

parameters.name: publicationId
parameters.description: Publication ID

200.description: Details of the publication that was just unpublished.

403.description: A 403 response means that the publication you want to version does not belong to this submission or that the publication is already unpublished.

404.description: The publication could not be found.

get.description: Results are eordered by `datePublished`.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many results to return in a single request. Max is `100`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset the results returned. Use this to receive subsequent pages of requests. A `count` of `10` and `offset` of `15` will return results `15` to `25`.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order the results returned.

parameters.name: orderDirection
parameters.description: Return the results in ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: isPublished
parameters.description: Filter returned issues by those that have been published. Pass a `false` value to return only unpublished issues. Only administrators and journal managers are allowed to access unpublished issues.

parameters.name: volumes
parameters.description: Filter returned issues by those in a specific volume.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: Filter returned issues by those assigned a specific number.

parameters.name: years
parameters.description: Filter returned issues by those in a specific year.

parameters.name: searchPhrase
parameters.description: Filter the results by a search phrase matched against the title, description and year. It will also attempt to match search phrases using the localised issue identification. For example, in English a search for `Vol. 1 No. 2 (2018)` will match an issue with a volume of `1`, a number of `2` and a year of `2018`. The precise format differs for each language.

200.description: List of issues.

400.description: The requested volume, number or year is not valid.

200.description: The current issue.

404.description: This journal does not have a current issue.

get.description: If the issue has a custom section order, the `seq` property of each `SectionSummary` will reflect the sequence for that issue.

parameters.name: issueId
parameters.description: Issue ID

200.description: The requested issue.

404.description: The requested issue could not be found.

parameters.name: roleIds
parameters.description: Filter the results by those who have one of these user role IDs.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter results by active/disabled users.

parameters.name: assignedToSubmission
parameters.description: Filter results by those assigned to this submission ID.

parameters.name: assignedToSubmissionStage
parameters.description: Filter results by those assigned to this submission stage. Will be ignored if no `assignedToSubmission` parameter exists.

parameters.name: assignedToSection
parameters.description: Filter the results by those assigned as section editors to this section ID.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many results to return in a single request. Max is `100`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset the results returned. Use this to receive subsequent pages of requests. A `count` of `10` and `offset` of `15` will return results `15` to `25`.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order the results returned.

parameters.name: orderDirection
parameters.description: Return the results in ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: searchPhrase
parameters.description: Filter the results by a search phrase matched against the `userName`, `givenName`, `familyName`, `email`, `affiliation`, `biography` and `orcid`.

200.description: A list of users.

403.description: Only administrators, journal managers and editors are allowed to access users on this site.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User ID

200.description: User details.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter results by active/disabled users.

parameters.name: reviewerRating
parameters.description: Filter results by those who have an average review assignment rating of at least `X` (valid ratings are between `1` and `5`).

parameters.name: reviewStage
parameters.description: Filter results by reviewers for one of the review stages in the workflow. Must be one of `WORKFLOW_STAGE_ID_INTERNAL_REVIEW` or `WORKFLOW_STAGE_ID_EXTERNAL_REVIEW`. In OJS, the review stage is `WORKFLOW_STAGE_ID_EXTERNAL_REVIEW`.

parameters.name: reviewsCompleted
parameters.description: Filter results by those who have completed at least `X` reviews. You can also pass a range as a string formatted as `X-X`.

parameters.name: reviewsActive
parameters.description: Filter results by those who have `X` review assignments currently in progress. You can also pass a range as a string formatted as `X-X`.

parameters.name: daysSinceLastAssignment
parameters.description: Filter results by those who's last review was assigned at least `X` days ago. You can also pass a range as a string formatted as `X-X`.

parameters.name: averageCompletion
parameters.description: Filter results by those who complete a review assignment within `X` days on average.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many results to return in a single request. Max is `100`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset the results returned. Use this to receive subsequent pages of requests. A `count` of `10` and `offset` of `15` will return results `15` to `25`.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order the results returned.

parameters.name: orderDirection
parameters.description: Return the results in ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: searchPhrase
parameters.description: Filter the results by a search phrase matched against the `userName`, `givenName`, `familyName`, `email`, `affiliation`, `biography`, `orcid`, `interests`, and `gossip`.

200.description: List of reviewers.

403.description: Only administrators, journal managers and editors are allowed to access users on this site.

get.description: Get an array of the journals (OJS), presses (OMP) or preprint servers (OPS) hosted on this site.

parameters.name: isEnabled
parameters.description: Filter results by enabled/disabled contexts. Any truthy or falsey value will get enabled/disabled contexts. Leave this parameter out to get all contexts.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many results to return in a single request. Max is `100`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset the results returned. Use this to receive subsequent pages of requests.

parameters.name: searchPhrase
parameters.description: Filter results by a search phrase matched against the `name`, `description`, `acronym`, or `abbreviation`.

200.description: List of contexts.

403.description: You do not have permission to view disabled contexts.

post.description: Create a new journal (OJS), press (OMP) or preprint server (OPS).

requestBody.description: Details about the context that should be created. The `path` field is required. The `name` is required in the site's primary locale.

200.description: Details of the context that was just added.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: Context ID

200.description: Context details. Some details may be withheld if you are not a site admin or manager of that context.

403.description: You do not have permission to view this context.

404.description: The requested context could not be found.

put.description: Edit a journal (OJS), press (OMP) or preprint server (OPS).

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: Context ID

requestBody.description: The details about a context that you want to edit. All params are optional. When a param is omitted, the existing value of that param will not be modified.

200.description: The context that was just edited with the current values after the edit has occurred.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

403.description: There are two possible conditions that will result in a `403` response. 1. You do not have permission to edit this context. 2. You submitted changes for one context from the API endpoint of another context. To edit a context, you must make a request to that context's API endpoint or the site-wide API endpoint.

404.description: The requested context could not be found.

delete.description: Delete a journal (OJS), press (OMP) or preprint server (OPS).

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: Context ID

200.description: Details of the context that was just deleted.

403.description: You do not have permission to delete this context.

404.description: The requested context could not be found.

get.description: Get the active theme and theme options for any journal (OJS), press (OMP) or preprint server (OPS).

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: Context ID

200.description: The response will include the theme plugin directory in `themePluginPath`. Any theme options will be provided in additional keys based on the option name.

403.description: You do not have permission to view this context.

404.description: The requested context could not be found. A 404 may also be returned when a context has no active theme, or the active theme plugin has not been installed or enabled.

put.description: Edit the active theme and theme options for any journal (OJS), press (OMP) or preprint server (OPS).

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: Context ID

200.description: The new theme and values for any of its theme options.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

403.description: There are two possible conditions that will result in a `403` response. 1. You do not have permission to edit this context. 2. You submitted changes for one context from the API endpoint of another context. To edit a context, you must make a request to that context's API endpoint or the site-wide API endpoint.

404.description: The requested context could not be found.

200.description: Site settings.

requestBody.description: The details about the site that you want to edit. All params are optional. When a param is omitted, the existing value of that param will not be modified.

200.description: The site details with the current values after the edit has occurred.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

get.description: Get the active theme and theme options for the site.

200.description: The response will include the theme plugin directory in `themePluginPath`. Any theme options will be provided in additional keys based on the option name.

404.description: Details about the active theme could not be found. This can occur when the active theme plugin is not installed or enabled.

put.description: Get the active theme and theme options for the site.

200.description: The new theme and values for any of its theme options.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many results to return in a single request.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset the results returned. Use this to receive subsequent pages of requests.

parameters.name: searchPhrase
parameters.description: Filter results by a search phrase matched against the `title`, `descriptionShort`, and `description`.

parameters.name: typeIds
parameters.description: Filter results by announcements of these announcement types.

200.description: List of announcements.

403.description: You do not have permission to view announcements in this context.

post.description: Create and publish a new announcement in this context.

requestBody.description: Details about the announcement that should be created.

200.description: Details of the announcement that was just added.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

parameters.name: announcementId
parameters.description: Announcement ID

200.description: Announcement details.

403.description: You do not have permission to view this announcement.

404.description: The requested announcement could not be found. Or you requested an announcement that is not part of this context.

parameters.name: announcementId
parameters.description: Announcement ID

requestBody.description: The details about the announcement that you want to edit. All params are optional. When a param is omitted, the existing value of that param will not be modified.

200.description: The announcement that was just edited with the current values after the edit has occurred.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

403.description: You do not have permission to edit this announcement.

404.description: The requested announcement could not be found.

parameters.name: announcementId
parameters.description: Announcement ID

200.description: Details of the announcement that was just deleted.

403.description: You do not have permission to delete this announcement.

404.description: The requested announcement could not be found.

parameters.name: isEnabled
parameters.description: Filter results by enabled/disabled email templates. Any truthy or falsey value will get enabled/disabled email templates.

parameters.name: isCustom
parameters.description: Filter results by those with or without a default template. A truthy value will return only templates with a key that does not match one of the default templates. A falsey value will return only templates with a key that matches one of the default templates. Note that a default template may be customized, but this does not qualify for `isCustom`. Only completely custom templates, not a customization of a default template, will be returned when `isCustom` is `true`.

parameters.name: fromRoleIds
parameters.description: Filter results by email templates sent by one or more role IDs.

parameters.name: toRoleIds
parameters.description: Filter results by email templates received by one or more role IDs.

parameters.name: searchPhrase
parameters.description: Filter results by a search phrase matched against the `key`, `subject`, `body`, or `description`.

parameters.name: stageIds
parameters.description: Filter results by email templates that belong to one or more workflow stage IDs. Pass `0` to return templates not assigned to a stage.

200.description: List of email templates.

403.description: You do not have permission to view email templates.

requestBody.description: Details about the email template that should be created.

200.description: Details of the email template that was just added.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

get.summary: Get an email template by key.
get.description: Email templates are fetched by their key, rather than ID, so that a default template is retrieved if it has not been customized. See the [documentation](https://docs.pkp.sfu.ca/dev/documentation/en/email-templates).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Email template key

200.description: Email template details.

403.description: You do not have permission to view email templates.

404.description: The requested email template could not be found.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Email template key

requestBody.description: The details about the email template that you want to edit. All params are optional. When a param is omitted, the existing value of that param will not be modified.

200.description: The email template that was just edited with the current values after the edit has occurred.

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

403.description: There are two possible conditions that will result in a `403` response. 1. You do not have permission to edit this email template. 2. You are an admin and you submitted changes for an email template in one context from the API endpoint of another context. To edit an email template, you must make a request to the API endpoint of that email template's context.

404.description: The requested email template could not be found.

delete.description: Default templates that have not been modified can not be deleted.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Email template key

200.description: Details of the email template that was just deleted.

403.description: You do not have permission to delete this email template.

404.description: The requested email template could not be found. This will be returned if you try to delete a default email template that has not been modified.

delete.description: Delete custom templates and reset all templates to their default settings.

200.description: A list of template keys which were deleted or reset.

get.description: Returns information about editorial activity such as the number of submissions accepted and declined, the number of days to reach editorial decisions, and the acceptance and rejection rates.

parameters.name: dateStart
parameters.description: Return stats after this date.

parameters.name: dateEnd
parameters.description: Return stats before this date.

parameters.name: sectionIds
parameters.description: Filter results by submissions to these sections.

200.description: An array containing the requested stats. The `name` may change with translation but the `key` will be a reliable, unique identifier for the statistic.

400.description: Your request was not valid. One or more of the request parameters will be invalid. The error message will contain details about the invalid parameter.

403.description: You do not have permission to access editorial statistics for this journal or press.

404.description: The requested resource was not found. This should only occur if the API is requested without specifying the context.

get.summary: Get yearly averages of editorial stats.
get.description: Returns yearly averages of editorial activity. To ensure averages are calculated fairly, partial years are not included in the averages. For example, if the first submission was received in October 2017 and the last submission was received in the current calendar year, only submissions from 2018 up until the end of the previous calendar year will be used to calculate the average.

parameters.name: sectionIds
parameters.description: Filter results by submissions to these sections.

200.description: An object containing the requested averages. Each property matches one of the properties from `/stats/editorial`. The value `-1` may be returned for a property if an average can not be calculated. This can occur if there is not a full calendar year of activity to average.

403.description: You do not have permission to access editorial statistics for this journal or press.

404.description: The requested resource was not found. This should only occur if the API is requested without specifying the context.

get.summary: Get the views of a publication.
get.description: Returns a list of publications ordered by their total abstract views. Includes total views by abstract, all galleys, PDF galleys, HTML galleys and other galleys.

parameters.name: dateStart
parameters.description: Return stats for publications after this date.

parameters.name: dateEnd
parameters.description: Return stats for publications before this date.

parameters.name: sectionIds
parameters.description: Filter results by publications in these sections.

parameters.name: submissionIds
parameters.description: Filter results by these submissions.

parameters.name: searchPhrase
parameters.description: Filter results by publications that match this search phrase. Searches the same submission properties as the `searchPhrase` parameter in the `/submissions` endpoint.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many publications to return in a single request. Max is `100`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset the publications returned. Use this to receive subsequent pages of requests.

parameters.name: orderDirection
parameters.description: Return the results in ascending or descending order.

200.description: A list of publications with their total stats during the requested period.

400.description: Your request was not valid. One or more of the request parameters will be invalid. The error message will contain details about the invalid parameter.

403.description: You do not have permission to access statistics for this journal or press.

404.description: The requested resource was not found.

get.summary: Get abstract views by day or month.
get.description: Returns a monthly or daily timeline of abstract views for the publications which match the request parameters.

parameters.name: timelineInterval
parameters.description: Return the total daily or monthly views

parameters.name: dateStart
parameters.description: Return stats for publications after this date.

parameters.name: dateEnd
parameters.description: Return stats for publications before this date.

parameters.name: sectionIds
parameters.description: Filter results by publications in these sections.

parameters.name: submissionIds
parameters.description: Filter results by these submissions.

parameters.name: searchPhrase
parameters.description: Filter results by publications that match this search phrase. Searches the same submission properties as the `searchPhrase` parameter in the `/submissions` endpoint.

200.description: A list of days or months with the total stats for that day or month.

400.description: Your request was not valid. One or more of the request parameters will be invalid. The error message will contain details about the invalid parameter.

403.description: You do not have permission to access statistics for this journal or press.

404.description: The requested resource was not found.

get.summary: Get galley views by day or month.
get.description: Returns a monthly or daily timeline of galley views for the publications which match the request parameters.

parameters.name: timelineInterval
parameters.description: Return the total daily or monthly views.

parameters.name: dateStart
parameters.description: Return stats for publications after this date.

parameters.name: dateEnd
parameters.description: Return stats for publications before this date.

parameters.name: sectionIds

parameters.name: searchPhrase

200.description: A list of days or months with the total stats for that day or month.

400.description: Your request was not valid. One or more of the request parameters will be invalid. The error message will contain details about the invalid parameter.

403.description: You do not have permission to access statistics for this journal or press.

404.description: The requested resource was not found.

get.summary: Get one publication's views by type.
get.description: Returns a publication's total views by abstract, all galleys, PDF galleys, HTML galleys and other galleys.

parameters.name: dateStart
parameters.description: Return stats for publications after this date.

parameters.name: dateEnd
parameters.description: Return stats for publications before this date.

200.description: The total stats for the publication during the period requested.

400.description: Your request was not valid. One or more of the request parameters will be invalid. The error message will contain details about the invalid parameter.

403.description: You do not have permission to access statistics for this journal or press.

404.description: The requested resource was not found.

get.summary: Get onne publication's abstract views by day or month.
get.description: Returns a monthly or daily timeline of abstract views for the requested publication.

parameters.name: timelineInterval
parameters.description: Return the total daily or monthly views

parameters.name: dateStart
parameters.description: Return stats for publications after this date.

parameters.name: dateEnd
parameters.description: Return stats for publications before this date.

200.description: A list of days or months with the total stats for that day or month.

400.description: Your request was not valid. One or more of the request parameters will be invalid. The error message will contain details about the invalid parameter.

403.description: You do not have permission to access statistics for this journal or press.

get.summary: Get one publication's galley views by day or month.
get.description: Returns a monthly or daily timeline of galley views for the requested publication.

parameters.description: Return the total daily or monthly views.

parameters.name: dateStart
parameters.description: Return stats for publications after this date.

parameters.name: dateEnd

200.description: A list of days or months with the total stats for that day or month.

400.description: Your request was not valid. One or more of the request parameters will be invalid. The error message will contain details about the invalid parameter.

get.description:
Returns a count of the number of user registrations broken down by roles.

Please note when using the `registeredBefore` and `registeredAfter` parameters that role counts reflect current user roles.

A user who registered as an author in January, 2019 but was later appointed to subeditor will be counted as a subeditor when the registration date range includes January, 2019.

parameters.name: registeredAfter
parameters.description: Return counts reflecting users who registered after this date.

parameters.name: registeredBefore
parameters.description: Return counts reflecting users who registered before this date.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Count `active` or `disabled` users. Default: `active`.

200.description: An object containing the requested stats. The `id` relects the `ROLE_ID_*` constant in the application.

400.description: Your request was not valid. One or more of the request parameters will be invalid. The error message will contain details about the invalid parameter.

403.description: You do not have permission to access user statistics for this journal or press.

404.description: The requested resource was not found. This should only occur if the API is requested without specifying the context.

parameters.name: vocab
parameters.description: The type of controlled vocab you want to retrieve entries for. One of `CONTROLLED_VOCAB_*`.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The locale key, such as `en_US`, you want to retrieve entries for. If no `locale` is provided, entries will be provided in the user's current locale or fall back to the journal's primary locale.

200.description: A list of the entries available in this journal.

400.description: The `locale` that you requested is not supported in this journal.

404.description: The journal you requested could not be found.

options.description: Responds with the appopriate headers to indicate file uploads maybe be sent, required by some file upload utilities which send a preflight request.

200.description: An empty response body.

post.description: Upload a file to the temporary file storage area and receive a temporary file ID.

requestBody.description: Use any parameter key to upload your file. The API endpoint will retrieve the first uploaded file.

200.description: The temporary file ID to use in other API requests.

400.description: No uploaded file could be found.

put.description: This endpoint is used on the settings page to save payment plugin settings alongside the general journal settings for enabling payments and setting the currency.

requestBody.description: None of these properties are required. In addition to `paymentsEnabled` and `currency`, you may pass any property that corresponds with a setting for an enabled `paymethod` plugin.

200.description: The parameters you submitted

400.description: The values you sent with the request did not pass validation. The response will contain information about which parameters failed validation.

options.description: Responds with the appopriate headers to indicate file uploads maybe be sent, required by some file upload utilities which send a preflight request.

200.description: An empty response body.

post.description: The user's public file directory supports files uploaded through the TinyMCE rich text editor. This is commonly used in context settings but is also available to all registered users through their profile biography.

requestBody.description: Use the `file` key to upload your file.

200.description: An object containing the URL to the uploaded file.

400.description:
One of the following errors occurred.
* No uploaded file could be found.
* This file type is not supported.
* The file you uploaded identifies itself as an image but it is not a valid image.
* The mime-type did not match the file extension.
* The file is too large.
* The server configuration could not support this file upload because there is no temporary directory, it doesn't have permission to write to the directory, or a PHP extension stopped the file upload.

The error message will contain further details.

403.description: You do not have permission to upload this public file.

409.description: The upload failed for an unknown reason.

413.description: Your user file directory is full.

500.description: The server is unable to read or write to the public files directory.

get.description: This endpoint delivers a little bit of extra information about each submission that is used in the submissions list. This private endpoint saves a few extra HTTP requests, but it is more database-intensive for each query.

parameters.description: Accepts most parameters supported by the public `/submissions` endpoint.

200.description: List of submissions.

ThemeOptions.description: The details you want to edit. The `themePluginPath` is required to specify the active theme, even if the theme is not being changed. Any additional keys/values must match the options defined by that theme.

_href.description: The URL to this announcement in the REST API.

assocId.description: The journal, press or preprint server ID.

assocType.description: The assoc object. This should always be `ASSOC_TYPE_JOURNAL` (OJS), `ASSOC_TYPE_PRESS` (OMP) or `ASSOC_TYPE_SERVER` (OPS).

dateExpire.description: (Optional) The date that this announcement expires, if one is set. This is typically used to express closing dates for calls for papers.

datePosted.description: The date this announcement was posted.

typeId.description: (Optional) One of the announcement type ids.

includeInBrowse.description: Whether or not to include this contributor in author lists when the publication appears in search results, tables of content and catalog entries.

orcid.description: The ORCID of this contributor. See: https://orcid.org/

seq.description: The order in which this contributor should appear in a list of contriibutors.

submissionLocale.description: The primary locale of the submission this author is attached to. This locale is used as the fallback when a language is missing from a multilingual property.

url.description: An optional URL to this contributor's webpage.

userGroupId.description: in which user group should this contributor be identified. Usually one of the author roles, such as Author or Translator.

agencies.description: Enable agencies metadata. `0` is disabled. `enable` will make it available in the workflow. `request` will allow an author to enter a value during submission. `require` will require that the author enter a value during submission.

citations.description: Enable citations metadata. `0` is disabled. `enable` will make it available in the workflow. `request` will allow an author to enter a value during submission. `require` will require that the author enter a value during submission.

coverage.description: Enable coverage metadata. `0` is disabled. `enable` will make it available in the workflow. `request` will allow an author to enter a value during submission. `require` will require that the author enter a value during submission.

disableBulkEmailUserGroups.description: User groups that a manager will be prevented from sending bulk email to using the notify feature. Only the admin may edit this property.

disciplines.description: Enable disciplines metadata. `0` is disabled. `enable` will make it available in the workflow. `request` will allow an author to enter a value during submission. `require` will require that the author enter a value during submission.

keywords.description: Enable keywords metadata. `0` is disabled. `enable` will make it available in the workflow. `request` will allow an author to enter a value during submission. `require` will require that the author enter a value during submission.

languages.description: Enable languages metadata. `0` is disabled. `enable` will make it available in the workflow. `request` will allow an author to enter a value during submission. `require` will require that the author enter a value during submission.

rights.description: Enable rights metadata. `0` is disabled. `enable` will make it available in the workflow. `request` will allow an author to enter a value during submission. `require` will require that the author enter a value during submission.

source.description: Enable source metadata. `0` is disabled. `enable` will make it available in the workflow. `request` will allow an author to enter a value during submission. `require` will require that the author enter a value during submission.

subjects.description: Enable subjects metadata. `0` is disabled. `enable` will make it available in the workflow. `request` will allow an author to enter a value during submission. `require` will require that the author enter a value during submission.

type.description: Enable types metadata. `0` is disabled. `enable` will make it available in the workflow. `request` will allow an author to enter a value during submission. `require` will require that the author enter a value during submission.

ErrorResponse.description: A response object that will be returned when the request could not be fulfilled.

canDisable.description: Can this email template be disabled in the context settings area? Default is `true`.

canEdit.description: Can this email template be edited in the context settings area? Default is `true`.

contextId.description: The ID of the context (journal/press) this email is related to. Only used for custom email templates. Default is `null`.

enabled.description: Is this email template enabled? Default is `true`.

fromRoleId.description: The `ROLE_ID_*` of the user who will send this email.

key.description: A unique key for this email template.

stageId.description: The `WORKFLOW_STAGE_ID_*` that email template is associated with or `null` if it is not associated with a stage.

toRoleId.description: The `ROLE_ID_*` of the user who will receive this email.

label.description: A human-readable label for this galley. For the primary article, it is usually indicates the format like PDF, ePub or full text. For supplementary files it often indicates the content, such as source data or interview transcripts.

locale.description: The primary locale of this galley.

pub-id::publisher-id.description: A unique ID provided by the publisher. It will be used in the publication's URL path instead of the `id` when present.

seq.description: In what order this galley should appear in lists of galleys for this publication.

urlPath.description: An optional path to use in the URL instead of the ID.

urlPublished.description: The URL where this galley can be viewed or downloaded.

urlRemote.description: An optional URL where the galley can be viewed or downloaded.

InvalidParametersResponse.description: A response object that will be returned when there are validation errors for the request parameters. Typically used with forms.

name: You must provide a name to create a new user.
roles: You must assign the user to one or more roles.

urlPath.description: An optional path to use in the URL instead of the ID.

LocaleObject.description: Key/value pairs containing data stored by locale key.

authors.description: A list of the authors for this publication.

authorsString.description: All of the authors rendered with the appropriate separators according to the locale.

authorsStringShort.description: A shortened version of the authors rendered with the appropriate separators according to the locale.

citations.description: Optional metadata that contains an array of references for works cited in this submission. References have been split and parsed from the raw text.

citationsRaw.description: Optional metadata that contains references for works cited in this submission as raw text.

copyrightYear.description: The copyright year for this publication.

disciplines.description: Optional metadata that describes the submission's types of study or branches of knowledge.

hideAuthor.description: Whether the contributor details should be displayed for this publication. Commonly used for editorial statements without individual authorship.

keywords.description: Optional metadata, usually one- to three-word phrases that are used to indicate the main topics of a submission.

languages.description: Optional metadata that identifies the submission's primary language.

licenseUrl.description: A URL to a webpage describing the license terms for this publication.

locale.description: The primary locale of the submission this publication is attached to. This locale is used as the fallback when a language is missing from a multilingual property.

pages.description: The pages of the issue in which this article appears if it is published in a physical format.

primaryContactId.description: Which `contributor` is the primary contact for this publication.

pub-id::publisher-id.description: A unique ID provided by the publisher. It will be used in the publication's URL path instead of the `id` when present.

status.description: Whether the publication is Queued (not yet scheduled for publication), Declined, Published or Scheduled (scheduled for publication at a future date). One of the `STATUS_*` constants. Default is `STATUS_QUEUED`.

subjects.description: Optional metadata that consists of keywords, key phrases or classification codes that describe the submission's topics.

supportingAgencies.description: Optional metadata that indicates the source of research funding or other institutional support.

urlPath.description: An optional path to use in the URL instead of the ID.

urlPublished.description: The public URL for this publication or where it will be available if it has not yet been published.

version.description: The version number of this publication. Version numbers should increment by one so that the third publication of a submission will have the version number `3`. Version numbers should typically be set automatically and editorial staff should not be encouraged to modify them.

PublicationStats.description: The total abstract and galley views for a published submission.

ReviewerSummary.description: A special representation of a User assigned to a reviewer group. This model presents specific details about review activity.

enableBulkEmails.description: Which hosted journals, presses or preprint servers are allowed to send bulk emails.

currentPublicationId.description: Which publication is the latest published version.

dateLastActivity.description: The last time activity was recorded related to this submission.

lastModified.description: The last time a modification was made to this submission or any of its associated objects.

locale.description: The primary language of this submission.

publications.description: A list of publications that have been created for this submission.

reviewAssignments.description: Information about pending and completed review assignments.

reviewRounds.description: A list of review rounds that have been opened for this submission.

stageId.description: The stage of the editorial workflow that this submission is currently in. One of the `WORKFLOW_STAGE_` constants. Default is `WORKFLOW_STAGE_SUBMISSION`.

stages.description: Key data about the status, files and discussions of each stage.

status.description: Whether the submission is Published, Declined, Scheduled or Queued (still in the workflow). One of the `STATUS_*` constants. Default is `STATUS_QUEUED`.

statusLabel.description: A human-readable version of the submission's status. It will be Published, Declined, Queued (still in the workflow) or Scheduled.

submissionProgress.description: This number tracks a submission's progress before it is submitted to the journal or press. After submission, it will be set to `0`, indicating it is ready for an editor's consideration.

urlAuthorWorkflow.description: A URL to the author's editorial workflow.

urlEditorialWorkflow.description: A URL to the editors' and assistants' editorial workflow.

urlPublished.description: A URL to the current publication or where it will be published.

urlWorkflow.description: A URL to the workflow most appropriate for the current user. It will match the `urlAuthorWorkflow` or `urlEditorialWorkflow.

assocId.description: Used with `assocType` to associate this file with an object such as a galley.

assocType.description: Used with `assocId` to associate this file with an object such as a galley. One of the following constants: `ASSOC_TYPE_SUBMISSION_FILE` (dependent files), `ASSOC_TYPE_REVIEW_ASSIGNMENT` (files uploaded by a reviewer), `ASSOC_TYPE_NOTE` (files uploaded with a discussion), `ASSOC_TYPE_REPRESENTATION` (files uploaded to a galley or publication format), `ASSOC_TYPE_REVIEW_ROUND` (review files and revisions for a particular review round).

caption.description: A caption for this file. Used with artwork such as images.

copyrightOwner.description: The copyright owner of this file. Used with artwork such as images.

createdAt.description: The date this submission file object was created in the system. Set automatically by the software.

credit.description: An attribution for this file, such as a photographer's name. Used with artwork such as images.

dateCreated.description: Public metadata about when this content was created. Used with supplementary files.

dependentFiles.description: Any dependent files, typically images or audio files that are loaded by an HTML file.

language.description: The language of this file if it contains text. Used with supplementary files.

locale.description: The primary locale of the submission this file is attached to. This locale is used as the fallback when a language is missing from a multilingual property.

sourceSubmissionFileId.description: When a submission file is promoted from one stage to another, this property identifies the source file from which this file was promoted. Default: `null`.

terms.description: Licensing terms for this file. Used with artwork such as images.

updatedAt.description: When this object was last updated.

ThemeOptions.description: A theme with values for any of its theme options. The theme is provided in the `themePluginPath` key. Other keys may or may not exist depending on what options have been defined by that theme.

assocId.description: The journal, press or preprint server ID.

assocType.description: The assoc object. This should always be `ASSOC_TYPE_JOURNAL` (OJS), `ASSOC_TYPE_PRESS` (OMP) or `ASSOC_TYPE_SERVER` (OPS).

dateExpire.description: (Optional) The date that this announcement expires, if one is set. This is typically used to express closing dates for calls for papers.

datePosted.description: The date this announcement was posted.

typeId.description: (Optional) One of the announcement type ids.

pub-id::publisher-id.description: A unique ID provided by the publisher. It will be used in the publication's URL path instead of the `id` when present.

status.description: Whether the publication is Queued (not yet scheduled for publication), Declined, Published or Scheduled (scheduled for publication at a future date). One of the `STATUS_*` constants. Default is `STATUS_QUEUED`.

urlPublished.description: The public URL for this publication or where it will be available if it has not yet been published.

version.description: The version number of this publication. Version numbers should increment by one so that the third publication of a submission will have the version number `3`. Version numbers should typically be set automatically and editorial staff should not be encouraged to modify them.

enableBulkEmails.description: Which hosted journals, presses or preprint servers are allowed to send bulk emails.

currentPublicationId.description: Which publication is the latest published version.

dateLastActivity.description: The last time activity was recorded related to this submission.

lastModified.description: The last time a modification was made to this submission or any of its associated objects.

locale.description: The primary language of this submission.

stageId.description: The stage of the editorial workflow that this submission is currently in. One of the `WORKFLOW_STAGE_` constants. Default is `WORKFLOW_STAGE_SUBMISSION`.

status.description: Whether the submission is Published, Declined, Scheduled or Queued (still in the workflow). One of the `STATUS_*` constants. Default is `STATUS_QUEUED`.

submissionProgress.description: This number tracks a submission's progress before it is submitted to the journal or press. After submission, it will be set to `0`, indicating it is ready for an editor's consideration.

currentPublicationId.description: Which publication is the latest published version.

dateLastActivity.description: The last time activity was recorded related to this submission.

lastModified.description: The last time a modification was made to this submission or any of its associated objects.

locale.description: The primary language of this submission.

publications.description: A list of publications that have been created for this submission.

stageId.description: The stage of the editorial workflow that this submission is currently in. One of the `WORKFLOW_STAGE_` constants. Default is `WORKFLOW_STAGE_SUBMISSION`.

status.description: Whether the submission is Published, Declined, Scheduled or Queued (still in the workflow). One of the `STATUS_*` constants. Default is `STATUS_QUEUED`.

statusLabel.description: A human-readable version of the submission's status. It will be Published, Declined, Queued (still in the workflow) or Scheduled.

submissionProgress.description: This number tracks a submission's progress before it is submitted to the journal or press. After submission, it will be set to `0`, indicating it is ready for an editor's consideration.

urlAuthorWorkflow.description: A URL to the author's editorial workflow.

urlEditorialWorkflow.description: A URL to the editors' and assistants' editorial workflow.

urlPublished.description: A URL to the current publication or where it will be published.

urlWorkflow.description: A URL to the workflow most appropriate for the current user. It will match the `urlAuthorWorkflow` or `urlEditorialWorkflow.

assocId.description: Used with `assocType` to associate this file with an object such as a galley.

assocType.description: Used with `assocId` to associate this file with an object such as a galley. One of the following constants: `ASSOC_TYPE_SUBMISSION_FILE` (dependent files), `ASSOC_TYPE_REVIEW_ASSIGNMENT` (files uploaded by a reviewer), `ASSOC_TYPE_NOTE` (files uploaded with a discussion), `ASSOC_TYPE_REPRESENTATION` (files uploaded to a galley or publication format), `ASSOC_TYPE_REVIEW_ROUND` (review files and revisions for a particular review round).

caption.description: A caption for this file. Used with artwork such as images.

copyrightOwner.description: The copyright owner of this file. Used with artwork such as images.

createdAt.description: The date this submission file object was created in the system. Set automatically by the software.

credit.description: An attribution for this file, such as a photographer's name. Used with artwork such as images.

dateCreated.description: Public metadata about when this content was created. Used with supplementary files.

language.description: The language of this file if it contains text. Used with supplementary files.

sourceSubmissionFileId.description: When a submission file is promoted from one stage to another, this property identifies the source file from which this file was promoted. Default: `null`.

terms.description: Licensing terms for this file. Used with artwork such as images.

updatedAt.description: When this object was last updated.

assocId.description: Used with `assocType` to associate this file with an object such as a galley.

assocType.description: Used with `assocId` to associate this file with an object such as a galley. One of the following constants: `ASSOC_TYPE_SUBMISSION_FILE` (dependent files), `ASSOC_TYPE_REVIEW_ASSIGNMENT` (files uploaded by a reviewer), `ASSOC_TYPE_NOTE` (files uploaded with a discussion), `ASSOC_TYPE_REPRESENTATION` (files uploaded to a galley or publication format), `ASSOC_TYPE_REVIEW_ROUND` (review files and revisions for a particular review round).

caption.description: A caption for this file. Used with artwork such as images.

copyrightOwner.description: The copyright owner of this file. Used with artwork such as images.

createdAt.description: The date this submission file object was created in the system. Set automatically by the software.

credit.description: An attribution for this file, such as a photographer's name. Used with artwork such as images.

dateCreated.description: Public metadata about when this content was created. Used with supplementary files.

language.description: The language of this file if it contains text. Used with supplementary files.

locale.description: The primary locale of the submission this file is attached to. This locale is used as the fallback when a language is missing from a multilingual property.

sourceSubmissionFileId.description: When a submission file is promoted from one stage to another, this property identifies the source file from which this file was promoted. Default: `null`.

terms.description: Licensing terms for this file. Used with artwork such as images.

updatedAt.description: When this object was last updated.
